learning_outcomes.description: Identify and describe theories and challenges of tourism policy and planning at a destination level – including how events can be used for destination development.

Critically analyse and evaluate the management of destinations and recognise and compare various challenges and approaches in both public and private sector policy and planning at different scales from the local through state and national.
Analyse and interpret factors that affect the appeal of destinations from both a demand and supply side perspective and identify the roles and responsibilities of various stakeholders.
Critically discuss factors that influence successful destination development.
As a group, create applied solutions and demonstrate the ability to critique and make recommendations for tourism policy, planning and development.

assessments.task_description:
Leveraging international events to enhance accessibility

International events are often leveraged for economic, tourism, or social benefits. Brisbane has been awarded the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. Stakeholders within the city of Brisbane, along with a series of regional cities will seek to leverage the Games. 

This individual task is to develop a strategy for how a city within Queensland can leverage the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

You will need to choose one of the following cities: Brisbane, Sunshine Coast, Gold Coast, and Rockhampton.

Part A: Tourism Strategic Plan Review

To complete this assessment task, you are required to:

  1. Choose a Queensland city from the list above. Provide a brief overview of the city and its tourism development.
  2. Provide a brief synopsis of your chosen city’s tourism policy.
  3. Critically analyse how your chosen city's tourism policy links with regional, Queensland, and Australian tourism policy. To do this, you will need to consider the tourism strategic plans in terms of:
  • the key roles of stakeholders (private and public sector) have been identified and how effective their roles appear to be outlined.
  • evaluation of core components of the plan and how it complies with the core elements of a competitive destination.
  • evaluation of whether you feel it will be successful in developing a sustainable tourism plan
  • final recommendations (two to three).

Your 2500-word report-style paper should be double spaced (Times New Roman, 12 point font) and written in third person.

NB: Use appropriate academic citations and references to support your analysis and discussion.

While AI can be used to inform the paper, the work should be that of the student. AI will typically miss some of the key components of the analysis.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit to Turnitin through Blackboard Assessment link.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Event Leveraging Plan for Destination Management
assessments.due_date:
Week 11 Mon - Week 12 Mon

Presentations will be delivered during seminar sessions in weeks 11 and 12. You will be assigned a week in week 7.
assessments.task_description:
Leveraging international events to enhance accessibility

International events are often leveraged for economic, tourism, or social benefits. Brisbane has been awarded the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. Stakeholders within the city of Brisbane will seek to leverage the Games.

Your task is to develop a strategy for how a city within Queensland can leverage the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

Part B: Team Presentation (due weeks 11 – 12)

Working teams of 4-6 students you will:

  1. Choose a city that at least one of your team members has chosen in Part A.
  2. You should first briefly cover the tourism policy review completed in Part A (assignment one). 
  3. Develop and explain leveraging strategies you believe should be utilised by your chosen city in the lead up to the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. Be sure to outline the leverageable resource, opportunities, strategic objectives, and means.


Your 20 minute presentation will specifically outline leveraging strategies to achieve outcomes in your chosen city. You will be required to answer questions about your leveraging strategies (additional five minutes).

You will be marked on your presentation skills - you should not read from a script.

You will be required to ask and answer questions of all other teams presenting in the course from weeks 11 – 12.

Please Note: The presentation will be recorded for marking purposes per UQ Policy.

While AI can be used to inform the paper, the work should be that of the student. AI will typically miss some of the key components of the analysis. AI does not typically produce sound leveraging strategies.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
You are individually required to reflect on the feedback provided to all teams (not just your own) for the event leveraging assignment.

You should detail:

  • what are the key lessons you learnt about event leveraging?
  • what are common mistakes that people make when designing leveraging strategies based on feedback provided in class in weeks 11 and 12? Note, these should be specific to what is discussed in class.
  • if you were tasked with creating an event leveraging strategy in the future, what would you do differently?

Your reflection should be no more than 750 words.

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
